Killing Floor is by far the worst Zombie multiplayer game I've ever played. I recommend purchasing COD zombies before wasting the $20 on this game. From the glitches to the non voice communication between characters, it just ruins the experience for the player. I really want to like this game but it does nothing for me because my standards are set higher due to Black Ops and World at War.  
P.S. wtf is up with the bs sprint? there is no fn sprint, and who in their right minds would ever use that fn walk key????

An absolute must have for any fan of wave-based survival games! This is a third of the price of Call of Duty Black Ops 2, and you don't even have to purchase any new maps with intense complexity or play certain maps to use your favorite weapons! Just purchase the weapon DLCs and boom! You can use them in every map! Now for the Moon Base map, you will have to go there if you want the original ZED Gun. But it's only one weapon, and is not necessary. The gunplay is phenominal, the graphics are kind of low compared to the sequel but is amazing on it's own! The Zeds are fun to fight and the boss is delightful to obliterate. All in all, a 10/10!

Really boring game though and I'd recommend the sequel over this easily!

Reviewing games I played a long time ago:

I played a bit when it was still a mod for UT2004, this full version is more or less an improved version of it. Playing now it's pretty obvious it was a mod, the UI and production values are very basic and simplistic. It's not really my cup of tea, but it's definitly a fun experience for people who like this kind of co-op survival games, you can say it's a predecessor to the Call of Duty Zombie mode.
no tengas windows 10 el juego
you walk like you have crapped your pants so will take you half an hour to actually get anywhere.

Killing Floor remains the best of the co-op survival FPS games out there. Tons of progression, near 300 achievements, and great FPS mechanics. I started playing at LANs in college ~10+ years ago. Now it has helped introduce my wife to the FPS genre, and is always top of mind when we want to play something together.

If you prefer the realistic mechanics of Counter-Strike to arcade like mechanics of Wolfenstein, then you'll prefer Killing Floor to say. Left for Dead.

The only other thing I will say is if you do like Killing Floor 1 for the reason above, skip out on Killing Floor 2 (2 is a very different game(.

Cool map designs, appealing gib+gore system, awesome bullet time system that allows you to mow down your enemies with surgical precision. In depth enemy mechanics that go beyond "bigger enemy has more health and does more damage" and challenge you to think about how you engage each enemy, and multiple groups of enemies at the same time.
A few negatives are the long grind to max level perks, lack of single player content (which the original mod had) and the relative repetitiveness of gameplay. I think anyone who is interested in the survival horror genre will enjoy this gem of the 2000's, as any game of the genre is relatively repetitive and unrewarding other than the thrill of surviving itself.

I love this game hands down. It is a fantastic Co-op first person shooter that forces you to take each and every enemy into consideration. I mean even the weakest ZEDs of the bunch have a purpose to hinder you. I mainly recommend this to those either looking for a fun Co-op game, or those looking for a new twist on Zombie Wave survival.

Still a better love story than Twilight.

Also, a much better game than its sequel.

-De los mejores juegos de zombies coperativos.
Al principio en mis primeros 20 minutos no entendia nada de como funcionaba el juego pero luego despues de que entiendes la mecanica de sobrevivir a oleadas y comprar mejores armas en la tienda se vuelve muy adictivo el juego, hay bastantes mapas (mas de 20) y la verdad son muy divertidos de jugar.
-¿El multijugador esta muerto?
N O, hay gente  jugando y en cualquier momento puedes entrar al juego y echarte una partida, 
-¿La gente que lo juega es toxica?
EN LO ABSOLUTO, la gente que lo juega siempre te ayuda en todo lo que puede, si ven que tienes poca vida te curan y si ven que necesitas armas te dan dinero (el cual se consigue matando zombies) es super divertido jugar el online por que la gente es muy buena (esto se debe a que el juego es completamente coperativo en el online)
-¿Pay to win?
No, a pesar de que en el 2014 metieron armas de paga, (esto lo mas probable es porque necesitaban fondos poque al año siguente sacaron killing floor 2) las armas que no se consiguen con dlcs son igual de buenas para sobrevivir  (no entiendo como hay gente que se queja del juego por eso lol)

El juego es TOTALMENTE recomendable, de las mejores compras que puedes hacer con un presupuesto bajo :D
